question_title: What will be the value of "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 5-Year Constant Maturity, Quoted on an Investment Basis" on 2026-02-10?
summary: The 5-year Treasury yield on February 10, 2026 should remain close to the current level of 3.80%. With no FOMC meeting before resolution (next is March 17-18), Fed policy unchanged at 3.50-3.75%, and only 6 trading days until resolution, the status quo dominates. Using conservative volatility estimates (~17 bps over the horizon) to account for potential tariff-related news and economic data releases, the median forecast is approximately 3.79% with an 80% confidence interval of roughly 3.57-4.01%.

factors.description: Current yield at 3.80% provides strong anchor - short horizon means limited deviation expected
No FOMC meeting before resolution (next March 17-18) - policy stability supports status quo
Fed held rates at 3.50-3.75% in January - no imminent policy changes
Recent slight downward drift in yields (3.80% to lower) - minor bearish pressure
Tariff-related uncertainty adds volatility risk - widens distribution tails
